comment.author: 62379908@N00
comment._content:
She was a very large ship in 1912, but would look small parked beside a 21st Centurhy cruise ship or oil tanker.

I heard a story that might be true.  They say that one of the four stacks was a dummy added for looks. I don't know which one, but I would thing the first or last one.  Pictures sometimes show smoke from all four.  I think the smoke coming from number one looks fake in this picture.

Am I right?

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: My interest has been piqued. I think a visit to the Titanic website might be in order!

comment.author: 30151231@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/howard33] 

I believe it was the fourth funnel that was the fake, not the first.

comment.author: 39778011@N04
comment._content: 4th funnel is the dummy funnel for me.....

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: It seems that the 4th funnel IS the fake one. Cheked it out in a number of sources.

comment.author: 77471432@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/howard33]  Hi, one of the stacks was "so called" fake - it was the last - on the photo most right. However, the smoke isn´t fake - this stack served as a main exhaust of ventilation and stack from kitchen.

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/starejgrafik] Thanks for the clarification on that. It's all fascinating and a buzz for us here on the other side of the world to where it all happened, even to have collection items about the Titanic.

comment.author: 107050776@N08
comment._content: Too bad they really believed that God Himself could not sink this ship! I believe that along with peer pressure and thoughtlessness cost a lot of lives that day! May God bless them all and help them all to rest comfortably!
